page.title: 08CHANGES IN KINNEFF 1921_1985
page.content: Mr.Eddie, an ex_ pupil of Kinneff School, told us how our area has changed since{1921. The school}still has two teachers although the roll has fallen approximately 75%. School was held in the old building and no lunches were served. Children could complete their secondary education at Kinneff.{The village}is much bigger but has less shops. There used to be a post office, a shop, a tailor and two shoemakers. Mr Eddie's house had no electricity or running water.{Families were much bigger and mothers did not go out to work. On the{farms,}tractors have replaced horses. Fernieflatt used to have four pairs of horses. Wheat and barley are now grown instead of corn. Everyone has more{leisure time and travels much farther afield by car or bus. In 1921 most people walked.
